articles.title: Kim Jong Il Highly Praised in Bangladesh
Efforts to Bring about Decisive Phase for National Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Highly Praised in Bangladesh 
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi newspaper Blits devoted its three pages to a special write-up carrying the portrait of leader Kim Jong Il and photos showing his revolutionary activities on January 4 on the occasion of the New Year.
 It edited the full text of "Make a higher leap full of great ambition and confidence", a joint editorial of the newspapers of the party, the army and the youth league of the DPRK.    
 The paper in its articles noted that Kim Jong Il has ceaselessly inspected units of the Korean People's Army, showing profound love and benevolence for the servicepersons, and further strengthened and developed the revolutionary armed forces of the country to be invincible forces.
 It also carried several articles and photos introducing the achievements made by the Korean people in building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation under the leadership of  Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Korean People's Efforts for National Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Efforts to Bring about Decisive Phase for National Reunification Called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils will smash every move of the United States and the pro-American conservatives against the nation and reunification through a general march and offensive based on faith and will and bring about a decisive phase for building an independent, reunified country this year.
 This was stressed in "Let us make a general march toward a new society for independence, democracy and reunification full of fresh confidence and optimism!", a declaration on actions published at a meeting of the central committee of the federation on Jan. 6.    
 Recalling that last year the federation conducted a vigorous anti-U.S. struggle for independent reunification under the banner of cooperation for national independence, peace against war and for reunification and patriotism, the declaration said: The present reality evidently proves that it would be impossible to achieve independent reunification or progress and development of society without putting an end to the U.S. domination and interference.
 Stressing the need to hold high the flag of the federation, taking the lead in the advance for independence, democracy and reunification, the declaration called for placing the anti-U.S., anti-war struggle for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces on a more popular basis to deal a decisive blow at the U.S. system of domination.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial of DPRK Published in Austria
articles.content:
Korean People's Efforts for National Reunification Supported 
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The part of the DPRK's joint New Year editorial dealing with the issue of national reunification has been positively supported in different countries.
 Vladimir Tolstikov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, said in a statement on Jan. 5 the three-point patriotic movement is a movement for national reunification that all the Koreans should push ahead with through their concerted efforts irrespective of their differing ideology, ism, system, political grouping or affiliation.    
 As long as the United States pursues a high-handed policy and dominationism, keeping south Korea under its military occupation, it is impossible to ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, he said.    
 Urging the prompt withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea, he expressed firm solidarity with the Korean people in their efforts to set up a new milestone in the cause for national reunification through the patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity. 
 The Group for the Study of the Exploits of the Three Generals of Mt. Paektu in Democratic Congo noted in a statement on Jan. 4 that last year the Korean people waged a vigorous struggle to reunify the country independently under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration, rejecting outsiders' interference.
 We support the Korean people's tasks for this year to make a new leap forward in building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation with the might of Songun and their just cause for national reunification, the statement said.

articles.title: Removal of Concrete Wall in Korean Peninsula Urged
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial of DPRK Published in Austria 
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna published a special information bulletin on January 5, which carried a detailed gist of a joint New Year editorial of the newspapers of the party, the army and the youth league of the DPRK titled "Make a higher leap full of great ambition and confidence".

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Rally Held in S. Korea
S. Korean Authorities' Pro-U.S. Treachery Assailed
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Rally Held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Students under the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) reportedly held an anti-U.S. rally around the U.S. embassy in Seoul on January 7.
 Jang Song Hoe, chairperson of the General Student Council of Chonnam National University, in a speech said that Hanchongryon will take the lead in the anti-U.S. struggle of 2006 and the struggle against educational opening, appealing to all students to join in the struggle.
 Kim Po Kyong, chairperson of the General Student Council of Seoul National Industrial University, vehemently condemned the U.S. ambassador in Seoul for his reckless remarks hostile to the north.    
 The participants shouted slogans "The U.S., withdraw its hostile policy toward the north" and "The U.S. ambassador, go out of this land", carrying anti-U.S. literature in their hands.

articles.title: Giving Top Priority to National Defence Called for
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Pro-U.S. Treachery Assailed 
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities decided to extend the presence of their troops in Iraq last November and the "National Assembly" passed the motion calling for the extension of their presence. Rodong Sinmun today in a signed commentary terms this an intolerable act of submitting to the U.S.
 Through the passage of the motion the NA of south Korea disclosed its nature that it can not exist without toeing the U.S. line, the commentary says, and goes on:    
 The NA is beset with so many issues pending solution such as the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea, the issue of abolishing the "National Security Law" and the issue of saving economy from bankruptcy and the issue of people's living, urgent requirements of the times and the history of the nation. The NA, however, has persisted in such shameful acts as offering young- and middle-aged men as cannon fodder for a war of aggression launched by outsiders, instead of taking up those issues. Is there any need for it to exist then? The NA should feel ashamed for having passed the above-said motion at a time when the U.S., which started the Iraqi war, is contemplating the "reduction" of its forces. The NA should retract the motion at once. 
 The south Korean authorities are trying to curry favor with the U.S. through pro-American treachery, not lending an ear to the voices of all Koreans critical of their behavior. That will bring nothing but slavish submission and shame, the commentary warns.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Removing Main Obstacle to Reunification
articles.content:
Giving Top Priority to National Defence Called for 
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- National defence is the most important of the state policy guaranteeing the country's grandeur and prosperity, the people's happiness and the victorious advance of the revolution and the lifeline on which the victory of the revolution and the fate of the nation hinge, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a signed article.   It goes on:
 It is a lesson taught by history that a prosperous country can not be built without being guaranteed by a military force.    
 The national defence is the most important affair in the building of a great prosperous powerful nation in the Songun era as it makes it possible to consolidate the anti-imperialist military front as firm as a rock, strengthen the revolutionary ranks to be the invincible ones based on the perfect unity in thinking and purpose and build up tremendous state economic potential.    
 The history of the revolutionary struggle in the DPRK is a proud and victorious one as it has won one victory after another in the political and military confrontation with imperialism and protected the country, revolution and socialism by giving top priority to the national defence in the revolution.
 Political and military forces with the People's Army as a main force have grown invincible in the DPRK under the wise leadership the Workers' Party of Korea has provided, while giving priority to the national defence in each period of the revolutionary struggle and at its each stage.
 The WPK's Songun policy of attaching the greatest importance to the national defence in the revolution is a great policy as it has achieved the most solid unity of all servicepersons and people in thinking and purpose in the fierce class struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country.
 Enormous state economic potential in the Songun era is unthinkable without the development of the defence industry. This industry constitutes the lifeline for building a rich and powerful country and directing great efforts to bolstering the defence industry provides a sure guarantee for augmenting the state economic potential.

articles.title: Tradition of Supporting Army, Helping People
Great Revolutionary Activity, Inspiration to People
Kim Yong Dae Meets Polish Ambassador
Wreaths Placed before Bust of Kim Hyong Gwon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae Meets Polish Ambassador
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party, today met and conversed with Roman Iwaszkiewicz, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
